thread_title: UI Component Library & Boilerplate Analysis Session

1_narrative.title: Narrative & Context
items: Session focused on updating the UI component library and analyzing boilerplate coverage for multiple projects.
Updated the KIT_INDEX by removing Roomsfy and Community Management kits, adding Adify, Multi-concept Landing, and Finder kits, resulting in 38 total kits.
Imported Figma components for Finder (178 items) and Multi-concept Landing (18 items) into PostgreSQL via API.
Corrected screen inventories for Fitness (AI-driven, 10 MVP + 6 Phase 2 screens) and Enterprise (8 tabs, 47 screens, 7-level permissions, S>C>E governance) projects.
Read Notebook EnterpriseOS summary to understand full architecture: body metaphor, 5A Foundation, 17-step pipeline, 16-folder scaffold, 29 artifact types.
Built and then deprioritized a Flask API + dark UI page picker tool due to too many results requiring analysis first.
Conducted boilerplate coverage analysis: all 38 kits analyzed against 15 page-need categories across 4 builds, confirming 93 screens all covered.
Created BOILERPLATE_SELECTIONS.md with Tier 1 (8 primary), Tier 2 (8 specialist), and Tier 3 (4 domain-specific) boilerplates.

2_objectives.title: Objectives
items: Update KIT_INDEX to reflect current kit priorities.
Import new Figma kits (Finder, Multi-concept Landing) into PostgreSQL.
Correct and finalize screen inventories for Fitness and Enterprise projects.
Understand Notebook EnterpriseOS architecture.
Analyze boilerplate coverage across all kits and builds.
Select definitive top-level boilerplates for the component library.

3_success_criteria.title: Success Criteria
items: KIT_INDEX updated with correct 38 kits.
Figma components successfully imported to PostgreSQL.
Accurate screen inventories for Fitness and Enterprise projects.
Full understanding of Notebook EnterpriseOS architecture.
Boilerplate coverage analysis completed showing all 93 screens covered.
BOILERPLATE_SELECTIONS.md created with tiered selections.

4_decisions.title: Decisions & Rules
items: Chroma replaces Real Estate SaaS as core font stack for promo/SaaS (both use DM Sans, but Chroma has better pre-header elements and clean black/white/grey aesthetic).
Inter font stays for Brainwave/dashboard/back-end interfaces; DM Sans for front-end/promo only.
Briefberry is strictly for onboarding + presell vertical sequences, NOT general marketing.
Square Dashboard is not a top-level boilerplate, but has nice profile components.
Triply AI serves both Property AND Fitness projects for AI dashboard interfaces.

5_sops.title: SOPs / Workflows
items: Figma API import process for kits into PostgreSQL.
Boilerplate coverage analysis workflow: analyze 38 kits against 15 page-need categories across 4 builds.
Screen inventory correction process for project design directories.

6_scripts.title: Scripts / Commands
items: Flask API + dark UI page picker tool (built then deprioritized).
Thumbnail refresh script (backgrounded, partial completion: 2/39 kits refreshed).

7_inputs_outputs.title: Inputs & Outputs
items: Inputs: Figma kits (Finder with 178 items, Multi-concept Landing with 18 items), KIT_INDEX, screen inventory drafts, Notebook EnterpriseOS summary PDFs.
Outputs: KIT_INDEX.json and .md files, BOILERPLATE_SELECTIONS.md, SCREEN_INVENTORY.md for Fitness and Enterprise projects, SESSION_SOURCES.md, full session log.
PostgreSQL state: 19,837 items, 183 kits (38 target), all target kits imported.
Thumbnail refresh: partial (2/39 kits refreshed).
Notebook temp files: C:\Users\under\Downloads\Notebook_EnterpriseOS_temp\ (3 PDFs still unread).

8_missteps.title: Missteps / Errors / Risks
items: Page picker tool built but deprioritized due to generating too many results without prior analysis.
Thumbnail refresh script was backgrounded, only partially completed (2/39 kits).
Risk: Potential coverage gaps in boilerplate mapping after primary kit analysis.
Risk: Unverified differences between Chroma and Real Estate SaaS design systems.

9_blockers.title: Blockers
items: Page picker tool deprioritized due to overwhelming results requiring analysis first.
Thumbnail refresh script backgrounded, incomplete.
3 Notebook EnterpriseOS PDFs remain unread in temp directory.

items: KIT_INDEX update: Complete (38 kits).
Figma imports: Complete (Finder and Multi-concept Landing imported).
Screen inventories: Corrected and finalized for Fitness and Enterprise.
Notebook EnterpriseOS summary: Read and understood.
Page picker tool: Built but deprioritized.
Boilerplate coverage analysis: Complete (93 screens covered).
BOILERPLATE_SELECTIONS.md: Created.
Thumbnail refresh: In progress, partial.

Overall session work: Largely complete, with follow-up actions defined.

11_progress.title: Progress Markers
items: KIT_INDEX updated to final 38 kits.
Figma imports completed for two new kits.
Screen inventories corrected for two major projects.
Notebook EnterpriseOS architecture fully understood.
Boilerplate coverage analysis completed confirming 93 screens covered.
BOILERPLATE_SELECTIONS.md created with tiered structure.

12_refinements.title: Refinements
items: KIT_INDEX refined: removed Roomsfy and Community Management, added Adify, Multi-concept Landing, Finder.
Font stack refined: Chroma promoted over Real Estate SaaS for promo/SaaS; font usage rules clarified (Inter vs DM Sans).
Boilerplate selections refined into three tiers (8 primary, 8 specialist, 4 domain-specific).
Tooling refined: page picker tool deprioritized in favor of targeted analysis.

13_dependencies.title: Dependencies
items: PostgreSQL database for storing Figma components.
Figma API for component extraction.
Notebook EnterpriseOS documentation for architecture understanding.
Existing KIT_INDEX and screen inventories as baseline.
Thumbnail refresh script for kit visual updates.

14_entities.title: Entity Maps
items: Kits: 38 total, including Adify, Multi-concept Landing, Finder, Chroma, Real Estate SaaS, Briefberry, Square Dashboard, Triply AI, etc.
Projects: Fitness Platform (AI-driven), Enterprise Platform (8 tabs, 47 screens), Property, Brainwave.
Fonts: DM Sans (front-end/promo), Inter (Brainwave/dashboard/back-end).
Governance: S>C>E (likely System > Component > Element) for Enterprise permissions.
Architecture: Notebook EnterpriseOS with body metaphor, 5A Foundation, 17-step pipeline, 16-folder scaffold, 29 artifact types.
Database: PostgreSQL with 19,837 items, 183 kits.

Directories: 07_BUILD_FACTORY/PRJ_UI_Component_Library/03_Design/, 07_BUILD_FACTORY/PRJ_Fitness_Platform/03_Design/, 07_BUILD_FACTORY/PRJ_Enterprise_Platform/03_Design/, 04_KNOWLEDGE_LIBRARY/SESSION_ARCHIVE/2026-02/.

15_glossary.title: Glossary
items: KIT_INDEX: Index of UI component kits.
Boilerplate: Pre-designed screen templates or component sets.
5A Foundation: Part of Notebook EnterpriseOS architecture (specific meaning not detailed).
S>C>E Governance: Likely System > Component > Element permission hierarchy in Enterprise platform.
MVP: Minimum Viable Product (10 screens for Fitness).
Phase 2: Secondary development phase (6 screens for Fitness).
EKX-1: Extraction methodology used for this summary.

16_future.title: Future
items: Lock in top-level boilerplates definitively.
Drill into 93 screens: analyze features, flows, states, blocks, components.
Conduct targeted Figma API searches (5-10 options per section, not 500).
Identify coverage gaps after primary kit mapping.
Verify Chroma vs Real Estate SaaS design system differences.
Check if Coreik needs adding to kit index (mentioned but not in 38).

17_pending.title: Pending
items: Thumbnail refresh completion (37 kits remaining).
Reading 3 unread Notebook EnterpriseOS PDFs in temp directory.
Definitive locking of top-level boilerplates.
Detailed analysis of 93 screens.
Targeted Figma API searches.
Coverage gap identification.
Chroma vs Real Estate SaaS verification.
Coreik kit index check.

18_questions.title: Open Questions
items: What are the exact design system differences between Chroma and Real Estate SaaS?
Are there any coverage gaps in the boilerplate mapping after primary kit analysis?
Should Coreik be added to the KIT_INDEX?
What are the 5A Foundation details in Notebook EnterpriseOS?
What specific features, flows, and states exist within the 93 screens?

19_meta.title: Meta-Observations
items: Tool building (page picker) was deprioritized when it produced overwhelming data; analysis before automation was needed.
Boilerplate analysis successfully scaled to 38 kits and 93 screens using a categorical approach.
Decisions on font stacks and kit roles were made based on specific aesthetic and functional criteria.
Session combined high-level architecture review with detailed inventory and component management.

20_assets.title: Reusable Assets
items: BOILERPLATE_SELECTIONS.md (tiered boilerplate selection framework).
Updated KIT_INDEX.json/.md (structure for 38 kits).
Corrected SCREEN_INVENTORY.md templates for Fitness and Enterprise projects.
Flask API + dark UI page picker tool code (deprioritized but built).
Figma API import scripts for PostgreSQL.
Thumbnail refresh script (partial).
EKX-1 extraction template (this JSON structure).

summary: Session updated the UI component library KIT_INDEX to 38 kits, imported new Figma components, corrected project screen inventories, analyzed boilerplate coverage for 93 screens, and made key design system decisions including font stack changes. Work concluded with a tiered boilerplate selection and defined next steps for detailed screen analysis and gap identification.
